verses.kjv: Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.
verses.ct: 6 days before the Passover, Jesus arrived in Bethany, where Lazarus lived — the man Jesus had raised from the dead.

verses.kjv: There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him.
verses.ct: They prepared a dinner in his honor. Martha was serving the meal, and Lazarus was among those sitting at the table with Jesus.

verses.kjv: Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment.
verses.ct: Mary took about a pound of expensive perfume made from pure nard, poured it on Jesus' feet, and wiped his feet with her hair. The fragrance of the perfume filled the entire house.

verses.kjv: Then saith one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, which should betray him,
verses.ct: But one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon — the one who would later betray him — objected.

verses.kjv: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor?
verses.ct: "Why wasn't this perfume sold for 300 denarii and the money given to the poor?"

verses.kjv: This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.
verses.ct: He didn't say this because he actually cared about the poor. He said it because he was a thief — he managed the money bag and would help himself to what was put into it.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying hath she kept this.
verses.ct: Jesus responded, "Leave her alone. She has saved this for the day of my burial."

verses.kjv: For the poor always ye have with you; but me ye have not always.
verses.ct: "The poor will always be among you, but I will not always be with you."

verses.kjv: Much people of the Jews therefore knew that he was there: and they came not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
verses.ct: A large crowd of Jewish people found out that Jesus was there. They came not only because of Jesus but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.

verses.kjv: But the chief priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death;
verses.ct: So the chief priests made plans to kill Lazarus as well,

verses.kjv: Because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
verses.ct: because on account of him many Jewish people were leaving them and putting their faith in Jesus.

verses.kjv: On the next day much people that were come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
verses.ct: The next day, the large crowd that had come for the festival heard that Jesus was on his way to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Took branches of palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna: Blessed is the King of Israel that cometh in the name of the Lord.
verses.ct: They grabbed palm branches and went out to meet him, shouting, "Hosanna! Blessed is the King of Israel, who comes in the name of the Lord!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,
verses.ct: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, just as Scripture says:

verses.kjv: Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.
verses.ct: "Don't be afraid, daughter of Zion. Look — your King is coming, riding on a donkey's colt."

verses.kjv: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.
verses.ct: His disciples didn't understand any of this at the time. But after Jesus was glorified, they remembered that these things had been written about him and that the crowd had done these things for him.

verses.kjv: The people therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of his grave, and raised him from the dead, bare record.
verses.ct: The people who had been with Jesus when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead kept telling others about it.

verses.kjv: For this cause the people also met him, for that they heard that he had done this miracle.
verses.ct: That was also why the crowd went out to meet him — they had heard that he had performed this miracle.

verses.kjv: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Perceive ye how ye prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.
verses.ct: So the Pharisees said to each other, "You see? We're getting nowhere! The whole world is following him!"

verses.kjv: And there were certain Greeks among them that came up to worship at the feast:
verses.ct: Now there were some Greeks among those who had come up to worship at the festival.

verses.kjv: The same came therefore to Philip, which was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and desired him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
verses.ct: They approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and made a request: "Sir, we would like to meet Jesus."

verses.kjv: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: and again Andrew and Philip tell Jesus.
verses.ct: Philip went and told Andrew, and then Andrew and Philip together told Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified."

verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a corn of wheat fall into the ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth much fruit.
verses.ct: "Truly, truly, I tell you: unless a grain of wheat falls to the ground and dies, it remains just a single seed. But if it dies, it produces an abundant harvest."

verses.kjv: He that loveth his life shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
verses.ct: "Anyone who loves their life will lose it, and anyone who lets go of their life in this world will preserve it for eternal life."

verses.kjv: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will my Father honour.
verses.ct: "If anyone wants to serve me, they must follow me. Wherever I am, my servant will also be. If anyone serves me, my Father will honor them."

verses.kjv: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour: but for this cause came I unto this hour.
verses.ct: "Right now my soul is deeply troubled. What should I say — 'Father, rescue me from this hour'? No, this is the very reason I came to this hour."

verses.kjv: Father, glorify thy name. Then came there a voice from heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.
verses.ct: "Father, bring glory to your name." Then a voice came from heaven: "I have already brought glory to it, and I will bring glory to it again."

verses.kjv: The people therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it thundered: others said, An angel spake to him.
verses.ct: The crowd standing nearby heard it. Some said it was thunder. Others said, "An angel spoke to him."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said, This voice came not because of me, but for your sakes.
verses.ct: Jesus said, "That voice wasn't for my benefit — it was for yours."

verses.kjv: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.
verses.ct: "Now is the time of judgment for this world. Now the ruler of this world will be thrown out."

verses.kjv: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto me.
verses.ct: "And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw everyone to myself."

verses.kjv: This he said, signifying what death he should die.
verses.ct: He said this to indicate what kind of death he was going to die.

verses.kjv: The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?
verses.ct: The crowd responded, "We've learned from the Law that the Christ will remain forever. So how can you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?"

verses.kjv: Then Jesus said unto them, Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you: for he that walketh in darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "The light is with you for just a little while longer. Walk while you still have the light, before darkness overtakes you. Whoever walks in darkness doesn't know where they're going."

verses.kjv: While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light. These things spake Jesus, and departed, and did hide himself from them.
verses.ct: "While you have the light, put your trust in the light, so that you may become children of light." After saying these things, Jesus left and concealed himself from them.

verses.kjv: But though he had done so many miracles before them, yet they believed not on him:
verses.ct: Even though he had performed so many miracles right in front of them, they still did not believe in him.

verses.kjv: That the saying of Esaias the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? and to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?
verses.ct: This fulfilled what the prophet Isaiah had spoken: "Lord, who has believed our message? And to whom has the power of the Lord been revealed?"

verses.kjv: Therefore they could not believe, because that Esaias said again,
verses.ct: For this reason they were unable to believe, because Isaiah also said:

verses.kjv: He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart; that they should not see with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted, and I should heal them.
verses.ct: "He has blinded their eyes and hardened their hearts, so that they cannot see with their eyes or understand with their hearts, and turn to me so I could heal them."

verses.kjv: These things said Esaias, when he saw his glory, and spake of him.
verses.ct: Isaiah said these things because he saw his glory and spoke about him.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless among the chief rulers also many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess him, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:
verses.ct: Still, even among the leaders, many did believe in him. But because of the Pharisees, they wouldn't openly admit it, for fear of being expelled from the synagogue.

verses.kjv: For they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.
verses.ct: They valued human approval more than approval from God.

verses.kjv: Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.
verses.ct: Jesus declared loudly, "Whoever believes in me is not just believing in me, but in the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: And he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.
verses.ct: "And whoever sees me sees the one who sent me."

verses.kjv: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me should not abide in darkness.
verses.ct: "I have come as a light into the world, so that whoever believes in me will not remain in darkness."

verses.kjv: And if any man hear my words, and believe not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.ct: "If anyone hears my words and doesn't follow them, I am not the one who judges that person. I didn't come to judge the world but to save the world."

verses.kjv: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judge him in the last day.
verses.ct: "Whoever rejects me and doesn't accept my words already has a judge: the message I have spoken will judge them on the last day."

verses.kjv: For I have not spoken of myself; but the Father which sent me, he gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.
verses.ct: "Because I haven't spoken on my own authority. The Father who sent me gave me specific instructions about what to say and how to say it."

verses.kjv: And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.
verses.ct: "And I know that his command leads to eternal life. So whatever I say is exactly what the Father has told me to say."
